Package org.securecryptoconfig

The Secure Crypto Config Interface provides methods for the most common cryptographic use cases: Symmetric encryption, Asymmetric encryption, hashing, password hashing and Signing. The algorithms used for for the internal execution of the invoked use case is determined by the content of the Secure Crypto Config files. With the release of a new version of the Interface the files will be updated to use only currently secure algorithms and parameters. Therefore, it is necessary to update the SecureCryptoConfig library as soon as possible if a new version is provided to be able to be up-to-date with the current security standard. In this way the burden of making right choices for parameters and algorithms to implement secure code can be lifted from the user.

For implementing different use cases the most important methods can be found at SecureCryptoConfig. First create a instance of SecureCryptoConfig and invoke the corresponding method for the specific cryptographic use case that should be implemented.

One of the most importatnt use cases provided is the symmetric en/decryption. This can be realized with the Secure Crypto Config as follows: 
 
 byte[] plaintext = "Hello World!".getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
 SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
 // Encryption
 SCCCiphertext ciphertext = scc.encryptSymmetric(key, plaintext);
 // Decryption
 PlaintextContainer plain = scc.decryptSymmetric(key, ciphertext);
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SecureCryptoConfigInterface
    Interface defining methods that can be used to perform different cryptographic use cases.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    JSONReader
    Class for handling/parsing SCC file content
    PlaintextContainer
    Class for a container representing the plaintext processed in cryptographic use cases.
    SCCCiphertext
    Class representing a container for the ciphertext (as result from encrypting a plaintext).
    SCCHash
    Class representing a container for a cryptographic Hash.
    SCCInstance
    Class for JSON file processing.
    SCCInstanceKey
    Still work in progress!
    SCCInstancePublisher
    Class for JSON file processing.
    SCCInstanceUseCase
    Class for JSON file processing.
    SCCKey
    Class representing a container of a key used for cryptography operations like symmetric or asymmetric encryption.
    SCCPasswordHash
    Class representing a container for a cryptographic Password Hash.
    SCCSignature
    Class representing a container for a Digital Signature.
    SecureCryptoConfig
    Starting point for performing every cryptographic use case. The class contains methods for performing symmetric/asymmetric en/decryption, (password) hashing and signing.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    SCCKey.KeyType
    Type of the corresponding key.
    SCCKey.KeyUseCase
    Different use cases for which a key can be created.
    SecureCryptoConfig.SCCAlgorithm
    Contains all supported algorithm names
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    SCCException
    General Exception of the Secure Crypto Config.
